content:
On Sunday instead of watching the documentary on underwater basket weaving for the billionth time make a trip to Kimball Recital Hall or Cornerstone for a free concert PERIOD

The School of Musics faculty recitals continue this weekend with performances by Scott Anderson professor of trombone Ann ChangBarnes assistant visiting professor and graduate student Denise Witfoth Makinson PERIOD

 ChangBarnes said PERIOD 

The department will feature ChangBarnes and Anderson in a  p.m PERIOD trombone and piano recital Sunday at Kimball PERIOD This collaborative effort will feature works from twentieth century artists PERIOD

 Anderson said PERIOD 

Anderson also plans to perform a piece he has worked on for the last two years   by Iannis Xenakis PERIOD

 Anderson said PERIOD 

Later on Sunday afternoon Makinson will present an organ recital featuring works by Johann Sebastian Bach Samuel Scheidt and Georg Muffat PERIOD The  p.m PERIOD concert will be at Cornerstone PERIOD

ChangBarnes said the recital series is one of the perks of working at the university PERIOD

 she explained PERIOD 

Anderson said the series provides a chance to pass on his enthusiasm for more classical types of music PERIOD

 he said PERIOD
